title: Simple link-in-bio page with social links, booking button, and newsletter signup

requirements.text: Create a single-page link-in-bio layout that presents: (1) a profile header (name, short tagline, optional avatar), (2) a list of social link buttons, (3) a primary “Booking” button, and (4) a newsletter signup section with an email field and submit button.

quotes: i want to creat a simple link-in-bio page with socials , a booking button , and newsletter singup

acceptanceCriteria: The app renders as a single page with clearly separated sections for socials, booking, and newsletter signup.
Social links are displayed as a vertical list of buttons/tiles and open in a new tab.
A dedicated Booking button is visually primary and opens its configured URL in a new tab.
Newsletter section contains an email input and a submit button and is usable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Add a simple, developer-editable configuration for the page content (profile name/tagline, social links list, booking URL, and optional footer text) that can be changed without touching multiple components.

quotes: simple link-in-bio page with socials , a booking button

acceptanceCriteria: There is a single obvious place (e.g., one config object/module) where profile text, social links, and booking URL can be edited.
Changing the configuration updates the rendered page without additional code changes elsewhere.

requirements.text: Implement newsletter signup submission with basic client-side validation (required field + email format). Show clear success and error states inline (e.g., “Thanks for subscribing” or a validation message).
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting an empty email shows an inline validation error and does not send a request.
Submitting an invalid email format shows an inline validation error and does not send a request.
Submitting a valid email shows a success state after the backend confirms storage.
If the backend call fails, the UI shows a non-technical error message and allows retry.

requirements.text: Create backend storage for newsletter subscribers in the single Motoko actor, with an update method to add a subscriber email. Prevent obvious duplicates (case-insensitive compare) and store a created-at timestamp for each subscription.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes an update method to add a subscriber email.
Duplicate signups for the same email (case-insensitive) do not create multiple records.
Each stored subscriber record includes the email and a created-at timestamp.
Backend returns a success/failure result that the frontend can use to render states.

requirements.text: Add a creative, coherent visual theme for the link-in-bio page (colors, typography, spacing, button styles) and apply it consistently across all sections. Avoid a blue/purple default palette.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI has a consistent theme across header, buttons, and form controls (typography, spacing, radii, shadows).
Theme uses a non-blue/non-purple primary palette (e.g., warm neutrals with a single accent).
Layout is responsive and remains readable and attractive on small screens.

requirements.text: Use generated static images for a subtle page background and a default avatar, and render them from frontend static assets (do not fetch via backend).
acceptanceCriteria: The page uses the generated background image and default avatar image from frontend/public/assets/generated.
Images load without backend calls and appear correctly in production build.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not edit immutable frontend hook entrypoints; integrate via new components/modules as needed.
nonGoals: No multi-page site or blog functionality.
No third-party email marketing integration (e.g., Mailchimp/SendGrid) or sending emails.
No advanced admin dashboard for managing subscribers (beyond storing subscriptions).

required: Soft abstract gradient background with subtle grain (linkbio-bg.dim_1600x900.png)
